英語: European numerals/Arabic numerals/Hindu–Arabic numerals/European digits (in Unicode)
定義: 印度-阿拉伯數字的統稱。
Definitions: A general name of Hindu–Arabic numeral system.

定義: 印刷成品版面中的图文印刷区域（不含出血图像）(GB 9851.2-2008, 3.3)。
排字的度量单位，宽度等于同样字号全角的一半。
辅助文字记录语言的符号，是书面语的有机组成部分，用来表示语句的停顿、语气以及表示某成分（主要是词语）的特定性质和作用。(GB/T 15834-2011)
Definitions: The marks that aid texts to record language, they are organic part of wrtting language, expressing pause, mood and special nature and functions of some parts (mainly words) in a sentence.

英語: compression rules for consecutive punctuation marks
定義: 对位于行首、行尾或連續存在標點符号的其富餘空間進行調整的排版方式。
標號的作用是標明，主要標示某些成分（主要是詞語）的特定性質和作用。(GB/T 15834-2011)
Definitions: Puctuation marks for indication, mainly for marking the special nature and function of a part (mainly words) of a sentence.

定義: 為漢字標注發音的方式，主要有行間注等。
Definitions: The way to indicate the pronunciation of the Chinese characters, e.g. interlinear annotations.

定義: 西文字體的一种分类，此類字體中各字元的字幅大小不一。
超出成品幅面范围而被裁切掉的图像。(GB 9851.2-2008, 3.8)
Definitions: The part of graphics that goes beyond the edge of final page that will be trimmed off.

定義: 繁體中文常用的漢字編碼字符集標準之一，共收錄13,060個漢字。
版心下沿至成品幅面下沿之间的空白区域。(GB 9851.2-2008, 3.5)。
Definitions: The bottom margin between the edge of a trimmed page and the type area.

定義: 字号的一种计量单位，常用的英美点制下1点约为0.35146mm，也被音译作“磅（因）”。
點號的作用是點斷，主要表示停頓和語氣。分為句末點號和句內點號。(GB/T 15834-2011)
Definitions: Punctuation marks for breaking, mainly for pause and mood, including marks at end-sentence and in-sentence.

定義: 文本或文字靠近版面結尾的一端。通常，文字直排時底端在左，橫排在下。
文本或文字靠近版面起始的一端。通常，文字直排時頂端在右，橫排在上。
見標點符號附錄。
由語句組成的句群，一個段落由一至多個語句組成。
對字、行等各種元素的分布進行整理的方法。
見標點符號附錄。
在現代漢語以及一些方音里，一些詞彙的字音的韻母因捲舌動作而發生的音變現象。
Definitions: In standard Chinese and certain dialects, some words have rhotacized endings that result in phonetic changes to how the word sounds.

定義: 字形及筆畫相對較複雜的漢字體系。因使用時間較長，又名傳統漢字或正體漢字，與之對應者為簡體中文。
Definitions: The writing system of Chinese using characters that are relatively more complex in structure and stroke count. Known as Traditional Chinese because of its long history of use. Cf. Simplified Chinese.

定義: 以漢語詞為單位拼寫羅馬拼音的方式。
Definitions: The usage of words as the segmentation unit for the romanisation of Chinese.

定義: 見標點符號附錄。
Definitions: See appendix on punctuation.

定義: 見標點符號附錄。
Definitions: See appendix on punctuation.

定義: 以字為單位拼寫羅馬拼音的方式。
Definitions: The usage of characters as the segmentation unit for the romanisation of Chinese.

定義: 特定的符號里不得加入空隙的原則。
Definitions: The rules for certain punctuation marks that do not allow any spaces between them.

定義: 見標點符號附錄。
Definitions: See appendix on punctuation.

定義: 頁面中首行為前頁最後一個段落的末行者為孤行。
Definitions: Literally "orphan line", the paragraph-ending line that falls at the beginning of a new page or column, or the paragraph-opening line that appears by itself at the end of a page or column; both separated from the rest of the text.

定義: 段落末行僅有一個漢字，或一個漢字加上標點符號，該字即為孤字。
Definitions: Literally "orphan character", the paragraph-ending single character, with or without punctuation, became the last line of a paragraph.

定義: 一行的高度，西文里通常指基线到基线的距离。
Definitions: The height of a single line. Western scripts refer to this as the vertical distance between lines of text measured from base line to base line.

定義: 位於行間的批注，形態自由、長度不拘，時可超過一行。
Definitions: Comments included between lines, generally free-form with no restrictions on line length. These can exceed the length of a single line.

定義: 標注於行間的說明或文字讀音。
Definitions: Annotations between lines used to indicate the pronounciation of a word or an explanation of a word.

定義: 不同的標點依其性質，不得出現於行首或行尾的排版規則。
Definitions: Due to the varied nature of the different punctuation marks, punctuation rules for the start of a line differ from that for the end of a line.

英語: hanging punctuation marks for line end
定義: 將行尾的點號懸掛於版心之外的排版之式。
Definitions: Typesetting punctuation for line endings outside the margin of alignment, also known as hanging punctuation or exdentation.

定義: 《汉语拼音方案》给汉字注音和拼写普通话的一种方案，采用拉丁字母，并用附加符号表示声调，是帮助学习汉字和推广普通话的工具。
Definitions: Hanyu Pinyin provides a method of using Latin characters with diacritics to indicate tone. It is often used to teach Standard Chinese and encourage its use as a common language for communication.

定義: 中文的基本文字。
Definitions: Characters that form the basis of the Chinese language.

定義: 行内每字按水平方向由左至右，页内每行从上至下、每栏由左至右的排列方法，或者按此方法的排列状态。
Definitions: The process or the result of arranging characters on a line from left to right, of lines on a page from top to bottom, and/or of columns on a page from left to right.

定義: 將二字以上的詞組寫作一個漢字書寫單位的形式。
Definitions: A glyph form that combines two or more letters or ideographs.

定義: 使用可以移動的字塊進行文字排版及印刷的方式。
Definitions: The traditional printing method using movable type.

定義: 見標點符號附錄。
字形及筆畫相對較簡單的漢字體系，主要指中國大陸於20世紀60年代左右公布修訂的簡化漢字，與之對應者為繁體中文。
Definitions: The writing system of Chinese using characters that are relatively simpler in structure and stroke count, mainly refer to Jianhuazi (Simplified Character) published and revised in 1960s in Mainland China. Cf. Traditional Chinese.

定義: 為提示或突顯將文本括注起來的一類成對符號的總稱。
Definitions: General term for punctuation marks used within a sentence that to include additional information for clarification or for emphasis.

定義: 成對的引號、括號（夾注號）、書名號中，標注結束的字元。
Definitions: The ending character of the paired brackets, which include quotations, parentheses, Book Title Marks etc.

定義: 漢語音節的構成中，位於輔音和主要元音之間的過渡音。
Definitions: The semivowel between initial and main vowel in Chinese syllable.

定義: 見標點符號附錄。
行間注排版中，受標注的原文字詞或語句。
Definitions: A character to be annotated by ruby, ornament characters, or emphasis dots.

定義: 見標點符號附錄。
成對的引號、括號（夾注號）、書名號中，標注起始的字元。
Definitions: The opening character of the paired brackets, which include quotations, parentheses, Book Title Marks etc.

定義: 西文常用的字母。
Definitions: The letters of Latin alphabet.

定義: 將連續一系列的文章放在一頁里，按照文字閱讀方向分割成兩個以上的每一個獨立部分。
Definitions: A partition on a page in multi-column format.

定義: 欄與欄之間的間距。
Definitions: Amount of space between columns on a page.

定義: 見標點符號附錄。
將漢字依語言將其發音轉寫為拉丁字母的方式。
Definitions: The conversion system of writing from Chinese pronunciation into Roman/Latin script.

定義: 見標點符號附錄。
將文字依其外框緊密排列的排版方式。
Definitions: To arrange characters with no inter-character space between adjacent character frames.

定義: 文本或文字靠近該行行尾的一端。通常，文字直排時末端在下，橫排在右。
Definitions: The ending point of a line, meaning the bottom side in vertical writing mode, or the right side in horizontal writing mode.

定義: 見標點符號附錄。
現代標準漢語的特殊變調現象，無固定調値。
Definitions: A kind of special tone phenomenon in modern standard Chinese, with no fixed tone.

定義: 一種段落每行的行頭行尾分別對齊的排版方式。
Definitions: The alignment method to align on both the left and right ends of each line of one paragraph text.

定義: 排字的一種相對度量單位，宽度等于所使用的字號，用做排版宽度水平方向的度量。
漢語及漢語方言的音節結構，屬四聲之一，其調值之調型短而急促。
Definitions: One of four tones in Historical Chinese phonology, which has short and brief pitch.

定義: 見標點符號附錄。
音節的高低升降變化。漢語傳統音韻學里分為平、上、去、入等四聲。
Definitions: The pitch contours in language to distinguish lexical or grammatical meaning in one syllable. There are 4 tones, e.g. Ping (level), Shang (rising), Qu (departing), Ru (entering) in Historical Chinese phonology.

定義: 漢語字音音節開頭的輔音。
Definitions: The initial consonants of Chinese syllable.

定義: 文本或文字靠近該行行首的一端。通常，文字直排時末端在上，橫排在左。
Definitions: The text or character that is near the beginning of the line. Normally, when the text is in vertical writing mode, the starting point is on the top; in horizontal writing mode, the starting point is on the left.

定義: 見標點符號附錄。
於各字之間加入均匀空白的排版方式。
Definitions: A text setting with a uniform inter-character spacing.

定義: 版心上沿至成品幅面上沿之间的空白区域 (GB/T 9851.2-2008, 3.4)
Definitions: The top margin between the top edge of a trimmed page and the type area.

定義: 見標點符號附錄。
見標點符號附錄。
對文字進行合適地排版讓書面語言易認、易讀、有吸引力地展現出來的一種工藝。
Definitions: The art and technique of arranging type to make written language legible, readable, and appealing when displayed.

定義: 歐洲、美洲和大洋洲通行的文字。
Definitions: Writing systems derived from Greek and Latin.

定義: 在西文詞組音節間插入連字符來斷行的方式。
Definitions: Use of the hyphen to join words and to separate syllables of a single word.

定義: 見標點符號附錄。
漢語字音中一個音節中除聲母、聲調外的部分。
Definitions: The part in a Chinese syllable without initial and tone.

定義: 提供按列對齊文本功能的字元。
Definitions: Characters with the feature of tabulation.

定義: 見標點符號附錄。
行内每字按垂直方向由上至下，页内每行从右至左、每栏由上至下的排列方法，或者按此方法的排列状态。
Definitions: The process or the result of arranging characters on a line from top to bottom, of lines on a page from right to left, and/or of columns on a page from top to bottom.

定義: 以注文或基文的形式為漢語詞組提示原文或譯文，係行間注排版的一種實作方式。
Definitions: To prompt a Chinese term with its original or translation in the form of annotation text or base text, an instance of interlinear annotation.

英語: Chinese and Western mixed text composition
定義: 在中文文本中，包含部分西文時的處理方式。
Definitions: The process of interleaving Chinese text with Western text.

定義: 見標點符號附錄。
見標點符號附錄。
行間注排版中，標注於行間（原文字詞或語句旁側）以標注發音或釋義的文字。
Definitions: Interlinear text run indicating pronunciation or definitions.

定義: 「國語注音符號」及「台灣方音符號」的統稱。
Definitions: The general name of Mandarin Phonetic Symbols and Taiwanese Phonetic Symbols.

定義: 字符在行方向上的大小。
Definitions: Size of a character frame in the inline direction.

定義: 区别单个字符大小的表示方法(GB 9851.2-2008, 3.3)
Definitions: Dimensions of a character.

定義: 字符之間的空隙。
Definitions: The space between characters.

定義: 文字的字身框中，字圖實際分布的空間。
Definitions: Area in which glyph is drawn.

定義: 字母、文字或符號的一組集合，一個字體通常有一貫的筆畫與字形風格，用於印刷或螢幕渲染中。
Definitions: A set of letters, characters or symbols, which are designed to have coherent patterns to be used for printing or rendering to a computer screen.

定義: 具有相同基本设计的字形图像集合(GB/T 16964.1-1997, 3.6)，現多與字體混用。
Definitions: A set of glyphs with the same design, often referred to as typeface nowadays.

定義: 一个可辨认的抽象的图形符号，它不依赖于任何特定的设计(GB/T 16964.1-1997, 3.12)
Definitions: A symbol of identifiable abstraction, depending on no specific design.

定義: 頭尾對齊的前提下，保證各行文字在橫、縱軸二方向皆相互對齊排列於網格中的排版方式。
Definitions: The process, under the premise of justification, of arranging characters within grids to make sure that they are aligned in both horizontal and vertical axes.

定義: 在直排文本中，將成（小）組的字符橫排插入排版方式。
Definitions: To typeset a (small) group of characters horizontally within a vertical line of main text.
